Legal_Issue: Credibility of claimant and risk of harm
Credibility_Assessment: Claimant's credibility found lacking due to implausible story and failure to provide marriage certificate
Evidence_Type: Personal testimony, documentary evidence (absence of marriage certificate)
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of honor killing due to marriage to a Christian man
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of documentary proof of marriage and low incidence of honor killings in community
Application_Error: Failure to substantiate key elements of claim with credible evidence
Legal_Standard: Patently unreasonable test for factual findings
Application_Factor: Accessibility of marriage certificate claimed but not provided
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the Board made an error in assessing credibility and country conditions
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRB Guidelines on Women Persecuted for Reasons of Gender, Article 1A(2) of the Refugee Convention
Cause_of_Refusal: Doubt about authenticity of marriage and perceived low risk of harm
Legal_Provision_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Section 96 and 97
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to produce marriage certificate despite availability
Procedural_Fairness: Board provided opportunity to respond; no procedural defects identified
Document_Fraud: Alleged lack of documentation, but no explicit finding of forgery or fraud
Credibility_Issues: Inconsistencies in narrative and lack of corroboration
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claimant challenged reasonableness of Boardâ€™s adverse credibility finding
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Charter of Rights and Freedoms (implied)
Procedural_Issue: Standard of review in administrative appeals
